comments.body: LGTM. It doesn't look like `state` gets returned either.
IIRC, I saw it return state: "absent" once when I got a "Connection reset by peer" error. I guess that is to say I'm not really sure what its relationship is to when it should actually be returned.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +270,274 @@    type: string
    sample: file
status_code:
    description: the HTTP status code from the request
    returned: always

comments.body: Would it be better to use `lstrip()` just to be safe? I can't image a file name ending with `./` but I suppose that could be a valid file name.

`/` is the standard file separator on UNIX, so a file can't possibly end with `/` because it would be interpreted as a directory... Maybe on Windows or other system although I would bet it's forbidden everywhere.
